page.title: 13HEALTH
page.content: {ABERDARE GENERAL HOSPITAL The hospital is situated on the outskirts of the town. The original building was an Ironmaster's house until the conversion in 1917. It has 5 wards:'A' Ward (Gynaecology) has 20 beds;the Hann Ward (Geriatric) has 20 beds;'C' Ward (Orthopaedic) has 20 beds;the Kensole Ward (Children's) has 25 beds; and the Maternity Unit which has 35 beds. The A,C and Hann Wards' main drawback is the lack of a dayroom. There is also an operating theatre Unit, Day Unit for the Elderly and a Casualty Department. During 1985 it is hoped that cardiac arrest equipment can be purchased. The hospital provides a much needed service for the community and every patient we spoke to praised the staff for the care and attention they provide.
